title: Rebecca Alexander (politician)
text:
Rebecca Alexander (born November 4, 1958) is an American politician, businesswoman, and former teacher serving as a member of the <a href="Tennessee%20House%20of%20Representatives">Tennessee House of Representatives</a> from the 7th district. She assumed office on January 12, 2021.
Education.
Alexander graduated from <a href="Daniel%20Boone%20High%20School%20%28Tennessee%29">Daniel Boone High School</a> in <a href="Gray%2C%20Tennessee">Gray, Tennessee</a>. She then earned a Bachelor of Arts degree in English, sociology, and psychology from <a href="Milligan%20College">Milligan College</a> and a Master of Education from <a href="East%20Tennessee%20State%20University">East Tennessee State University</a>.
Career.
Alexander began her career as an English teacher. She then joined <a href="Magnavox">Magnavox</a>, eventually becoming a national sales manager with the organization. She also helped her husband operate his family's business, the Dillow-Taylor Funeral Home. Alexander was elected to the <a href="Tennessee%20House%20of%20Representatives">Tennessee House of Representatives</a> in November 2020.
Personal life.
She is married and has two daughters.
